thread.title: Paper mill releases water into Androscoggin - Maine news
thread.title_full: Paper mill releases water into Androscoggin - Maine news

author: boston.com
title: Paper mill releases water into Androscoggin - Maine news
text:
RUMFORD, Maine (AP) — The operator of a paper mill in Rumford has spilled 56,000 gallons of contaminated water into the Androscoggin River.
Catalyst mill spokesman Tony Lyons says the water used in the papermaking process was supposed to be stored in thermal sewers until it cools, but it was released into the river prematurely.
 He said the water that was released wasn’t a public health hazard.
The Maine Department of Environmental Protection was notified.
Local firefighters were alerted but weren’t dispatched. Rumford fire Chief Robert Chase described the spill to the Sun Journal newspaper as ‘‘benign’’ and said that ‘‘nothing was needed from the fire department.’’
